data.title: Total Tennis Wiki
data.text:
Samantha Stosur

Stosur, Samantha Career activity

1999 – January 2023 Date of birth (1984-03-30) 30 March 1984 (age 40) Country Australia Prize money $20,069,776 Singles Record No. 4 (21 February 2011) 607–457 (57.05%) Doubles Record No. 1 (6 February 2006) 450–256 (64.01%)

Samantha Stosur (born 30 March 1984) is a retired tennis player from Australia. Stosur achieved a career-high singles ranking of No. 4 reached on 21 February 2011, and a career-high doubles ranking of No. 1 reached on 6 February 2006.

Stosur is a former world number one doubles player, first holding the number one position for 22 weeks from 6 February 2006 to 9 July 2006. Stosur held the ranking on two separate occasions between February 2006 and April 2007, for a combined total of 61 weeks. Stosur's longest period consecutively as the world number one came from 10 July 2006 to 8 April 2007 for 61 weeks whilst teaming with Lisa Raymond.

Stosur played their first Billie Jean King Cup tie for Australia in 2003, with their last tie being in 2022. Stosur received 29 total nominations and played 34 ties. Stosur achieved a singles win–loss record of 29–20, and a doubles win–loss record of 10–1, for a total win–loss of 39–21.
